title: Live coverage: SpaceX targets Tuesday for next launch attempt of the Polaris Dawn mission
summary: The launch attempt was announced even as weather continues to be a challenge, both during the launch and landing dates of the spacecraft. Liftoff is set for Tuesday at 3:38 a.m. EDT (0738 UTC).

title: SpaceX plans Starlink and Polaris Dawn launches in consecutive days
summary: SpaceX is planning to launch a Starlink flight on Thursday and its groundbreaking Polaris Dawn mission on Friday, marking two significant launches...

title: Launch Roundup: Vega retired after final launch; Polaris Dawn set for new launch attempt
summary: This week, rockets will launch from all over the globe. To start the week, China’s CASC sent a Chang Zheng 4B on its 50th successful mission. The final launch of Arianespace’s Vega rocket went off without a hitch, and Polaris Dawn is expected to launch four private astronauts to low-Earth orbit, during which the world’s first private EVA out of Crew Dragon will take place.

title: FAA may have just pushed back SpaceX Polaris Dawn mission after Falcon 9 mishap
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) may have just caused a delay with SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn mission, which was set to launch soon....

title: Polaris Dawn Slips Again For a Different Kind of Weather Problem
summary: SpaceX’s Polaris Dawn mission with four private astronauts just scrubbed again, the third night in a row.  This time the problem is weather, but not the usual delay because of […]

title: Polaris Dawn on hold; SpaceX booster fails on landing
summary: Another busy week of spaceflight activities contained a landing failure of a Falcon 9 booster for the first time in over three years. Looking forward, Falcon 9 could launch up to five launches this week, including the Polaris Dawn mission, whose private crew will conduct an inspiring mission profile. However, that has been delayed due to an unacceptable splashdown forecast. Then, other SpaceX missions include up to three Starlink flights and another set of Starshield satellites to low-Earth orbit (LEO) for the National Reconnaissance Office.

title: SpaceX waiting to launch historic Polaris Dawn mission
summary: SpaceX is set to launch a mission that will not only see humans travel the farthest away from Earth since Apollo 17 in 1972 but also conduct the first-ever commercial spacewalk.

title: One of the most adventurous human spaceflights since Apollo may launch tonight
summary: Liftoff is set for 3:38 am ET in Florida.

title: Launch delay: SpaceX pushes Polaris Dawn astronaut launch due to splashdown weather concerns
summary: The crew trained for more than two-and-a-half years to prepare for their spacewalk and an on-orbit Starlink demonstration. Launch is now no earlier than Friday, Aug. 30, weather permitting.

title: SpaceX completes static fire test of its Falcon 9 rocket in preparation for the Polaris Dawn astronaut mission
summary: The ignition test of the nine Merlin engines at the base of the rocket came after the four crew members step through a dry dress rehearsal of their launch day activities. The T-0 for ignition happened at 6:38 a.m. EDT (1038 UTC).
